thread.title: Concept design of ZUK Z3 Pro surfaces, Snapdragon 835 and 8GB RAM in the offing
thread.title_full: Concept design of ZUK Z3 Pro surfaces, Snapdragon 835 and 8GB RAM in the offing

title: Concept design of ZUK Z3 Pro surfaces, Snapdragon 835 and 8GB RAM in the offing
text:
Concept design of ZUK Z3 Pro surfaces, Snapdragon 835 and 8GB RAM... Concept design of ZUK Z3 Pro surfaces, Snapdragon 835 and 8GB RAM in the offing   ZUK Z3 Pro will be one of the first smartphones to boast as much as 8GB of RAM” 
It appears that Lenovo’s sub-brand is ZUK is working on the successor to the Z2 Pro smartphone. Ahead of the official announcement, the upcoming phone, allegedly dubbed the ZUK Z3 Pro, has surfaced on the interwebs in some concept images. 
The concept suggests that the ZUK Z3 Pro will be a premium-looking device thanks to a metal frame and glass on the back. The phone will sport a single LED flash on the back, and what appears to be a laser autofocus system. Its power and volume rocker keys will be placed on the right side, and it will get a USB Type-C port and a speaker at the bottom. 
According to the reports, the ZUK Z3 Pro will be one of the first smartphones to boast 8GB of RAM. The phone will be powered by Qualcomm’s latest flagship SoC, the Snapdragon 835. It will also be available in a 6GB RAM variant. The storage options will include 128GB and 256GB. The other expected specs include a 16MP rear snapper, an 8MP front shooter, a 3,300mAh battery with Quick Charge 4.0 technology and a U-Touch fingerprint sensor. 
As per the reports, the ZUK Z3 Pro’s 6GB RAM variant will be priced at RMB 2,299 (around Rs 22,500), while the 8GB model will set you back by RMB 2,699 (approx. Rs 26,000). The phone is expected to be unveiled in April in China.
